Hi,

Thanks for you answer, but I'm trying a beanshell script right now.
An=
y way to do that with beanshells?

Thank you for your answers.

--- In arch=
ive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "Coram, Roger" <Roger.Coram@...> wrote:
>
> Hi=
,
> 
> We're using something that sounds vaguely similar:
> 
>  
> 
> https=
://github.com/openplanets/wap/tree/master/HeritrixMQ
> 
>  
> 
> The labori=
ously-name AsynchronousMQExtractor just, when an incoming URL
> matches a g=
iven regex, adds messages ("URL|output-path")  to a queue (a
> bare-bones R=
abbitMQ install) then a separate Python script pulls them
> off, submits th=
em to a webservice and writes the result to the
> output-path (which is ide=
ally Heritrix's 'Action' directory so the URL
> will be picked up and added=
 to the Frontier).
> 
>  
> 
> Roger
> 
>  
> 
> From: archive-crawler@yaho=
ogroups.com
> [mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of saskow2=
7

ubject: [archive-crawler] Creating a plugin that calls a webservice
> 
>  
=
> 
>   
> 
> Hi everyone,
> I created a webservice that executes javascript=
 code of a given URL and
> gives a JSON object containing all the links fou=
nd after the execution.
> Now I need to create a Heritrix plugin (add-on, m=
odule) that tells
> Heritrix, when an url pattern is matched, to call that =
webservice with
> that url then to update the frontier with the links found=
 in the JSON
> response.
> Unfortunately I am a newbie to Heritrix and I ne=
ed some hints in order
> to know where to start and first steps to follow.
=
> 
> Thank you for your help.
>
